title: Create .NET Solution and Project Structure
objective: Initialize the .NET solution with proper project structure for the CourtListener MCP server

assumptionAudit.notes: All specifications verified from plan document

agentInstructions:
**OBJECTIVE**: Initialize the .NET 9 solution and ASP.NET Core project structure for the CourtListener MCP server.

**CRITICAL CONTEXT**: This is the foundation task. No prior code exists. You are creating a brand new .NET solution from scratch.

**EXECUTION STEPS**:

1. **Create Solution**:
   - Navigate to: `C:\Users\tlewers\source\repos\court-listener-mcp\`
   - Run: `dotnet new sln -n CourtListener.MCP`
   - Verify: Solution file created successfully

2. **Create ASP.NET Core Project**:
   - Run: `dotnet new webapi -n CourtListener.MCP.Server -f net9.0`
   - Add project to solution: `dotnet sln add CourtListener.MCP.Server/CourtListener.MCP.Server.csproj`
   - Verify: Project builds with `dotnet build`

3. **Create Project Folder Structure**:
   - Create folders within `CourtListener.MCP.Server/`:
     - `Tools/` - MCP tool implementations
     - `Services/` - HTTP client and business logic
     - `Models/` - DTOs and entity models
     - `Configuration/` - Settings and options classes
   - Verify: All folders exist

4. **Create Initial README**:
   - Create `README.md` in solution root
   - Content should include:
     - Project title: "CourtListener MCP Server - .NET 9 Implementation"
     - Purpose: MCP server for CourtListener Case Law Research API
     - Technology stack: .NET 9, ASP.NET Core, C# MCP SDK
     - Reference to Python implementation location
     - Getting started placeholder (to be completed later)
     - Installation prerequisites: .NET 9 SDK
   - Verify: README exists and is well-formatted

5. **Verify Project Structure**:
   - Run `dotnet build` - must succeed
   - Verify folder structure matches plan
   - Verify README.md is complete

**DELIVERABLES**:
- `CourtListener.MCP.sln` - Solution file
- `CourtListener.MCP.Server/CourtListener.MCP.Server.csproj` - ASP.NET Core project
- Folder structure: Tools/, Services/, Models/, Configuration/
- `README.md` - Initial project documentation

**VERIFICATION CHECKLIST**:
- [ ] Solution file exists and contains project reference
- [ ] Project targets .NET 9 (net9.0)
- [ ] Project type is ASP.NET Core Web API
- [ ] All 4 required folders created
- [ ] README.md exists with required sections
- [ ] `dotnet build` succeeds with no errors
successCriteria: Project structure matches organizational patterns (Tools/, Services/, Models/, Configuration/)
README.md is complete with project overview and getting started placeholder
Project type is ASP.NET Core Web API
criticalAnchors: MUST use ASP.NET Core Web API template
MUST follow folder naming exactly: Tools, Services, Models, Configuration

associatedArtifacts.description: ASP.NET Core Web API project targeting .NET 9
HTTP client and business services (empty initially)
Project documentation with overview and setup instructions
